string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns00000100101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: MECHANICAL BRAKES
EMU TRAINSET - MECHANICAL BRAKES
Assessments Landing Page
How many brake control panels are there in one car?
What are the two chambers inside the Electro Pneumatic Relay Valve.
The emergency brake chamber is normally empty during normal service.
Choose 3 functions of the Brake System
Holding Brake application is automatically applied in all driving modes except one. Name the one driving mode where holding brake is not applied.
What is the function of the Check valve 1/2" C1.2? (Refer to the schematic on the last page).
How does the driver request service braking?
Choose one emergency brake command the train driver is able to override
At what pressure will the parking brake chamber be re-armed?
What is the function of speed sensors?
What are the working temperatures of the Electro Pneumatic Relay Valve?
Choose one component of the brake application system
How many brake units are there per six car train?
Choose two reasons for the special shaped channels that are cut into brake pads?
Figure 1 is the service and park brake calliper.
What is the gap that is kept between braking surfaces (pad and disc) during service?
What is the maximum allowed temperature of the brake discs?
How many friction rings does the brake disc consist of?
What are the two distinct systems of the Brake System?
How many brake panels are there per car?
How many brake units are there on 1 bogie?
Choose 3 functions of the Brake System
What is the maximum pressure which can be applied by the brake cylinders?
What is responsible for informing the EPC of the target pressure to be realised in the Brake Cylinders?
What state must AMV and RMV be in for braking to occur?
What is the ratio between the pilot and output pressure to the BC?
When the safety loop is broken, what happens?
What is the function of the average load valve?
What happens when the train speed exceeds the axle speed?
Which system is responsible for ensuring wheels do not slide?
How many parking brake units are there per bogie?
How many parking brake units are there per bogie?
Which component maintains the required gap between pad and disc?
Identify component (8) in Figure 1:
What is the maximum allowable “sustained” temperature of the brake discs?
Each disc contains how many segments?
If a disc is marked with “I” symbol what does it indicate?
LEARNING OBJECTIVES
Main Menu
Completed m 1
Brake Control and Application System Overview
Completed m 1
2 Brake Control System
2 Brake Control System
Operational Description
Brake Application System
There are 3 service brake calipers and 1 service/park brake calipers on each bogie.
When the brake manipulator is applied by the driver, that force directly applies 100% of the braking effort of the train to the braking calipers.
The maximum force that can be applied to the brake calipers is 500 kPa.
There are 2 speed sensors per bogie.
The BCP is located on TC car only.
The difference between the TC BCP and the MC BCP is that the TC BCP does not have an EPC.
The difference between the TC BCP and the MC BCP is that the TC BCP does not have an EPRV.
The SERC valve controls the air flow to be directed for service or emergency braking application.
Completed m 1
Completed m 1
Brake cylinders can handle a maximum pressure of 400 kPa.
What is the main component inside the Brake Control Panel?
How many cars are equipped with traction motors in one trainset?
What are the functions of the following valves? Double Diaphram Relay Valve (DDRV) Service Brake Limiting Valve (SBLV)
Choose two functions of the Holding Brake Application
Explain the degraded condition End of Day (EoD)
Name one way the train driver can trigger an emergency brake
What is the function of the Double Check Valve C1.6/C2.6? (Refer to the schematic on the last page).
At what speed is emergency brake automatically applied?
What is the maximum pressure that can be supplied to the Brake Control Panel?
What controls the air-suspension in each car?
When does wheel slide occur?
What is WSP responsible for?
How many parking brake units are there per six car train?
Brake pads have special shaped channels cut into them, what are the two reasons for the channels?
Which type of Calliper is Figure 1?
What allows for relative movements of the brake disc?
What is the maximum allowable “sustained” temperature of the brake discs?
If a disc is marked with “E” symbol what does it indicate?
